intro: Hemsleya obconica, commonly known as the obconic arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes plants such as taro and calla lilies. The plant features arrow-shaped leaves and produces small, white flowers that are clustered in an inflorescence. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a rhizomatous growth habit. Hemsleya obconica prefers moist, well-drained soil and partial to full shade in its natural habitat.
